mods.abstract: This issue includes articles about the launch of this newsletter, announcement of the website, how to use the collection, and new collections.

mods.abstract: This issue includes articles about photographer Dutch Roth and other early photographers of the Great Smoky Mountains; a review of Harvey Broome's "Out Under the Sky of the Great Smokies: A Personal Journal"; and a spotlight on Pack Memorial Library in Asheville, NC. .

mods.abstract: This issue includes articles about the acquisition of Rosemary Moorehead's 1936 scrapbook entitled "An Impression of the Pi Beta Phi Settlement School and Its Vicinity" as well as numerous photos from the scrapbook; and notable new books.

mods.abstract: This issue includes articles about writer Mary Noailles Murfree (Charles Egbert Craddock) and recent fiction set in the Smokies.

mods.abstract: This issue includes articles about the dialect spoken in the Smokies' region; a new partnership with the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts; gift from the Aslan Foundation; a review of Carson Brewer's "A Wonderment of Mountains: The Great Smokies"; upcoming digital collection of William Cox Cochran photographs.
mods.note: Volume 4, Number 2 does not exist. Volume 5, Number 1 follows Volume 4, Number 1 in the series.
